root.VtoN: Valentia to Newfoundland. Sent 1.30 P.M.—“Can you read? We have two Government messages. Will you take? Reply direct.”
root.NtoV: Newfoundland to Valentia. Sent 1.37 P.M.—“Try, but send.”
root.VtoN: Valentia to Newfoundland. Sent 3.41 P.M.—“The Military Secretary to Commander-in-Chief, Horse Guards, London. To General Trollope, Halifax, Nova Scotia:— The Sixty-second Regiment is not to return to England.”
root.exposition: [This message and that which will be found further on in regard to the Thirty-ninth Regiment, saved to the British Government the sum of fifty thousand pounds (250,000 dollars), by avoiding the shipment and transportation of troops.]
root.NtoV: Newfoundland to Valentia. Sent—“This received:—The Military Secretary to Commander-in-Chief, Horse Guards, London.” Sent—“‘Trollope,’ understand. Go on after Scotia.” Sent—“Is it finished after ‘England?’ ”
root.VtoN: Valentia to Newfoundland. Sent 4 P.M.—“Yes. Now take another. Are you ready?”
root.NtoV: Newfoundland to Valentia. Sent 4.5 P.M.—“Yes, send.”
root.VtoN: Valentia to Newfoundland. Sent 9.3 P.M.—“The Military Secretary to Commander-in-Chief, Horse Guards, to General Officer commanding, Montreal, Canada:—The Thirty-ninth Regiment is not to return to England.”
root.NtoV: Newfoundland to Valentia. Sent—“I want you to repeat ‘Canada.’”
root.VtoN: Valentia to Newfoundland. Sent 10.5 P.M.—“Can’t read. Try‘Daniel’s.”
root.NtoV: Newfoundland to Valentia. Sent 12 P.M.—“Repeat from ‘Canada’ to ‘return.’”
